pullRequest.body:
From sphere-eversion, I'm just submitting these.

---

Updated version of #10303.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [c2b75e87cb](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20585/commits/c2b75e87cb36bc0f4d03d508b22d8dbac937a2c0)

#### Import changes for modified files

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ContinuousOn.tendsto_nhdsSet`
`+ IsCompact.exists_thickening_image_subset`
`+ infDist_pos_iff_not_mem_closure`
`+ thickening_ball`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.02)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|59|1|large files|

Current commit [c2b75e87cb](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/c2b75e87cb36bc0f4d03d508b22d8dbac937a2c0)
Reference commit [8421da8699](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/8421da8699ad0386cf29f4c0e67497a819e04cba)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Thanks for the review nits; I have addressed them.
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.
bors merge
Thanks! Some nits below
This design decision may merit further discussion, as `thickening` is monotone in both delta and the E. I'm not sure which lemma is more useful...

```suggestion
  obtain âŸ¨V, hV, hsV, hVs'âŸ© := mem_nhdsSet_iff_exists.mp hs'
```

```suggestion
  hf.continuousOn.tendsto_nhdsSet univ_mem hst
```
This suggestion does not compile. Can you elaborate more what you meant?

Alternative proof you could put right next to `mem_closure_iff_infDist_zero`
```suggestion
    0 < infDist x s â†” x âˆ‰ closure s :=
  infDist_nonneg.gt_iff_ne.trans (mem_closure_iff_infDist_zero hs).not.symm
```
Note that the three similar lemmas have the mem on the LHS
Moved and flipped.

Should it not be
```suggestion
    (hf : âˆ€ x âˆˆ K, ContinuousAt f x) (hKU : MapsTo f K U) :
```
?

```suggestion
      _ = U := union_self _
```

```suggestion
    have : {f x} âŠ† U := by rw [singleton_subset_iff]; exact hKU hx
```
I'm not sure if we prefer `{f x}` or `{ f x }`, but I'm sure it's not this. (Also below)
Good point. I've checked, I think `{a}`for singleton sets is preferred.

```suggestion
  (mem_closure_iff_infDist_zero hs).not.trans infDist_nonneg.gt_iff_ne.symm
```

pullRequest.title: feat: three lemmas related to Hausdorff distance
